choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
Put together a healthy meal plan for me for seven days.  I can't have dairy, garlic, honey, almonds, pistachios, or cashews

### Response:


Sure, here is a sample meal plan for you for the week:

Day 1:
- Breakfast: Smoothie bowl made with spinach, kale, banana, and berries (without nuts)
- Lunch: Veggie wrap with hummus, avocado, cucumber, tomato, and lettuce
- Dinner: Grilled chicken breast with roasted vegetables (such as broccoli, sweet potatoes, and bell peppers) and quinoa or brown rice

Day 2:
- Breakfast: Greek yogurt with mixed berries and granola (without nuts)
- Lunch: Veggie soup with a side salad made with non-dairy dressing
- Dinner: Lentil soup with roasted vegetables (such as carrots, onions, and zucchini)

Day 3:
- Breakfast: Smoothie bowl made with banana, spinach, kale, berries, and almond milk
- Lunch: Veggie wrap with hummus, avocado, cucumber, tomato, and lettuce (without nuts)
- Dinner: Grilled salmon with roasted asparagus and quinoa or brown rice

Day 4:
- Breakfast: Greek yogurt with mixed berries and granola (without nuts)
- Lunch: Veggie soup with a side salad made with non-dairy dressing (without nuts)
- Dinner: Vegetable stir fry with tofu, edamame, and brown rice

Day 5:
- Breakfast: Smoothie bowl made with banana, spinach, kale, berries, and almond milk (without nuts)
- Lunch: Veggie wrap with hummus, avocado, cucumber, tomato, and lettuce (without nuts)
- Dinner: Grilled chicken breast with roasted vegetables (such as bell peppers, zucchini, and eggplant)

Day 6:
- Breakfast: Greek yogurt with mixed berries and granola (without nuts)
- Lunch: Veggie soup with a side salad made with non-dairy dressing (without nuts)
- Dinner: Vegetable curry with tofu or chickpeas

Day 7:
- Breakfast: Smoothie bowl made with banana, spinach, kale, berries, and almond milk (without nuts)
- Lunch: Veggie wrap with hummus, avocado, cucumber, tomato, and lettuce (without nuts)
- Dinner: Grilled salmon with roasted asparagus and quinoa or brown rice (with a side salad made with non-dairy dressing) 

Remember to always include a source of protein in your meals for muscle growth and repair. You can also add more fiber by including whole grains, fruits, and vegetables in your diet. Don't forget to stay hydrated throughout the day!
